name: Diagrams.net (aka draw.io)
description: Current standard for architecture (inc. C4), sequence and physical diagrams

name: Lucidchart
description: The need for licenses and the lack of any form of diagrams-as-code has pushed this to be avoided for new work

name: Mermaidjs
description: Although it has a limited set of diagrams this true diagrams-as-code shows promise for sequence diagrams

name: Online Wardley Maps
description: Diagrams-as-code for Wardley Maps.  Clear and simple to use

name: Miro
description: Tool of choice for remote collaborating on diagraming and/or general remote whiteboarding

name: Diagrams as Code
description: Storing diagrams in (hopefully) human readable form in the source control with the code.  Encourages more regular updating of diagrams and opens up the potential to capture a combined history of the code and documentation
